com.rwbsystems.HiveUnitTesting

Class HiveShellUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rwbsystems.HiveUnitTesting.HiveShellUtility

  • public class HiveShellUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains common functionality for interacting with the Hive shell.

      Runs a Hive script, replacing usage of Snappy compression with Gzip because Snappy isn't supported in HiveRunner.

    • Method Detail

      • executeResourceHql

        public void executeResourceHql(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell,
                               java.lang.String resourceFilename)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Executes the code of a single resource file in the hiveShell.

        PRECONDITION: hiveShell is already started and is running.

        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        resourceFilename - The relative path for an included resource file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the resource file cannot be opened, an IOException is thrown.

      • executeResourceHqlIgnoreIOException

        public void executeResourceHqlIgnoreIOException(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell,
                                                java.lang.String resourceFilename,
                                                java.lang.String exceptionMessage)
        Executes the code of a single resource file in the hiveShell, but if an exception occurs, it is caught and the exceptionMessage is printed to standard output.

        PRECONDITION: hiveShell is already started and is running.

        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        resourceFilename - The relative path for an included resource file.
        exceptionMessage - The message to be printed if an IOException is caught.

      • executeResourceHqlReplaceSnappyWithGzip

        public void executeResourceHqlReplaceSnappyWithGzip(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell,
                                                    java.lang.String resourceFilename)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Runs a Hive script, replacing usage of Snappy compression with Gzip because Snappy isn't supported in HiveRunner.
        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        resourceFilename - The relative path for an included resource file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getDatabases

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getDatabases(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell)
        Gets the Set of database names listed in the running HiveShell instance.
        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        Returns:
        A Set of unique database names in the running HiveShell instance.

      • getTablesInDatabase

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getTablesInDatabase(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell,
                                                           java.lang.String database)
        Gets a set of table names for tables that exist within a database.
        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        database - The name of the database that the list of tables will be generated for.
        Returns:
        A Set containing one entry for each table name in database

      • getColumnInfoForTable

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,HiveColumnInfo> getColumnInfoForTable(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell,
                                                                            java.lang.String database,
                                                                            java.lang.String table)
        Gets the column information as a Set of HiveColumnInfo objects for a table.
        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        database - The database name where the table exists.
        table - The name of the table to get column information for.
        Returns:
        A Set of HiveColumnInfo objects representing the column attributes for the table.

      • getRowCountInTable

        public int getRowCountInTable(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell,
                              java.lang.String database,
                              java.lang.String table)
        Gets the row count in a given table.
        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        database - The database name where the table exists.
        table - The table name for getting a row count.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the number of rows in the table.

      • getTableComment

        public java.lang.String getTableComment(com.klarna.hiverunner.HiveShell runningShell,
                                        java.lang.String database,
                                        java.lang.String table)
        Get's the comment attribute of a Hive table.
        Parameters:
        runningShell - A HiveShell that is already running.
        database - The database name where the table exists.
        table - The table name that the comment is being retrieved for.
        Returns:
